this is a direct quote, and refers to John 8:31 - please don't modify direct quotes, and please stop edit-warring, which the Arbcom has stated is harmful to Wikipedia
/* Anti-Judaism in the New Testament */ correction "did not believed" "did not believe"
There were two groups in the crowd of Jews, to those who did not believe him he said, "you belong...to the Devil" to those who believed. To Jews who believed him, he "..you are really my disciples"
/* Anti-Judaism in the New Testament */ John 8:31 is explicit that he is talking to the Jews, not "scribes and Pharisees"
